alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated another cluster of thunderstorms developing over northwest metro areas of Broward County. These thunderstorms could drift east into the advisory area which can produce another 1 to 2 inches in the advisory area. Therefore, the flood advisory will remain in effect until 730 PM EDT over Northeast Broward County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pompano Beach, Deerfield Beach, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Pointe, North Pompano Beach and Pompano Beach Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
